Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a plant with water and light, illustrating it as healthy with green leaves and a strong stem.
The student can draw a plant without water, depicting it with drooping leaves to show its unhealthy state.
The student can illustrate a plant without light, showing it with fewer or yellow leaves to represent its compromised condition.
The student can effectively use labels or arrows in their drawing to indicate what happens to plants with and without water or light.
The student can utilize different colors or symbols to clearly differentiate between plants that have water and light and those that do not, displaying patterns in their work.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit a minor label or detail, such as forgetting to label one of the plants or not coloring in part of a leaf fully *(minor oversight)*.
